title: composite electrolyte amd a lithum battery including the same

events.title: Application filed by Samsung Electronics Co Ltd

classifications.description: Accumulators with non-aqueous electrolyte characterised by the materials used as electrolytes, e.g. mixed inorganic/organic electrolytes
Rocking-chair batteries, i.e. batteries with lithium insertion or intercalation in both electrodes; Lithium-ion batteries
Polymeric materials, e.g. gel-type or solid-type
Liquid materials characterised by the solvents
Organic electrolyte characterised by the solvent
Composites in the form of mixtures
Composites in the form of layered products, e.g. coatings
Energy storage systems for electromobility, e.g. batteries

abstract: The present invention relates to a composite electrolyte comprising: a polymer ionic liquid; a plurality of inorganic particles; and an organic electrolyte, and a lithium battery including the same.
abstract_original: 本发明涉及复合电解质和包括其的锂电池，所述复合电解质包括：聚合物离子液体；多个无机颗粒；和有机电解质。
claims:
1. composite electrolyte, comprising:
      Polymer ions liquid;
      Multiple inorganic particle; With
      Organic bath.

2. the composite electrolyte of claim 1, wherein said inorganic particle comprises and is selected from following at least one: the oxide of metal oxide, metal hydroxides, metal carbonate, metal carboxylate, metal silicate, metal aluminosilicate, metal carbides, metal nitride, metal halide, metal nitrate, carbon, carbonaceous material and organic-inorganic composition.

3. the composite electrolyte of claim 1, wherein said inorganic particle comprises and is selected from following at least one: Al
          2o
          3, SiO
          2, BaTiO
          3, graphite oxide, graphene oxide, metallic organic framework, polyhedral oligomeric silsesquioxane, Li
          2cO
          3, Li
          3pO
          4, Li
          3n, Li
          3pS
          4, Li
          2o and montmorillonite.
4. the composite electrolyte of claim 1, the particle diameter of wherein said inorganic particle is less than 100 nanometers.

5. the composite electrolyte of claim 1, wherein based on the total weight of described inorganic particle and described polymer ions liquid, the amount of described inorganic particle is in 1 % by weight-95 % by weight scope.

6. the composite electrolyte of claim 1, wherein based on the total weight of described inorganic particle and described polymer ions liquid, the amount of described inorganic particle is in 30 % by weight-90 % by weight scopes.

7. the composite electrolyte of claim 1, wherein said polymer ions liquid is be selected from following at least one: cation type polymer ionic liquid, anionic polymer ionic liquid and amphoteric ion type polymer ions liquid.

The composite electrolyte of 11. claims 1, wherein said organic bath comprises at least one being selected from organic solvent and ionic liquid.

15. lithium batteries, comprising:
      Positive pole;
      Negative pole; With
      Be arranged on the dielectric substrate gone up at least partially of described negative pole,
      Wherein said dielectric substrate comprises the composite electrolyte of any one of claim 1-14.
The lithium battery of 16. claims 15, wherein said negative pole be coated with described dielectric substrate at least partially.
The lithium battery of 17. claims 15, the thickness of wherein said dielectric substrate is 40 microns or less.
The lithium battery of 18. claims 15, wherein said negative pole comprises lithium metal.
The lithium battery of 19. claims 18, the thickness of wherein said lithium metal is less than 100 microns.
The lithium battery of 20. claims 15, wherein said dielectric substrate has the sandwich construction comprising two or more layers.
The lithium battery of 21. claims 20, two or more layers wherein said have composition different from each other.
The lithium battery of 22. claims 20, two or more layers wherein said comprise and are selected from following at least one: liquid electrolyte, gel electrolyte and solid electrolyte.

The lithium battery of 23. claims 15, wherein, at 25 DEG C after 96 hours, the impedance of described lithium battery is in a ratio of 10% or less with the impedance of the lithium battery not containing composite electrolyte.
The lithium battery of 24. claims 15, it comprises the dividing plate be arranged between described positive pole and described negative pole further.
The lithium battery of 25. claims 15, it comprises the liquid electrolyte being adjacent to described positive pole further.
The lithium battery of 26. claims 25, the wherein said porous anode being just very impregnated with liquid electrolyte.
The lithium battery of 27. claims 15, wherein said positive pole comprises and is selected from following at least one: liquid electrolyte, gel electrolyte and solid electrolyte.

The lithium battery of 29. claims 28, wherein said solid electrolyte layer comprises and is selected from following at least one: ionic conduction polymer, polymer ions liquid, inorganic electrolyte, polymer substrate and electrically conductive polymer.

The lithium battery of 30. claims 29, wherein said solid electrolyte layer comprises and is selected from following at least one: poly(ethylene oxide), the solid graft copolymer comprising two or more polymer blocks with low Tg, poly-(diallyl dimethyl ammonium) two (fluoroform sulphonyl) imines, Cu

The lithium battery of 31. claims 29; wherein said ionic conduction polymer comprises ionic conductivity repetitive, and described ionic conductivity repetitive derives from and is selected from following at least one: ether monomer, acryl monomer, methacryl monomer and siloxanyl monomers.

The lithium battery of 32. claims 31, wherein said ionic conduction polymer is be selected from following at least one: poly(ethylene oxide), PPOX, polymethyl methacrylate, polyethyl methacrylate, dimethyl silicone polymer, polyacrylic acid, polymethylacrylic acid, polymethyl acrylate, polyethyl acrylate, polyacrylic acid 2-Octyl Nitrite, polybutyl methacrylate, polymethylacrylic acid 2-Octyl Nitrite, polyacrylic acid ester in the last of the ten Heavenly stems and polyethylene vinylacetate.
The lithium battery of 33. claims 29, wherein said ionic conduction polymer is the copolymer comprising ionic conductivity repetitive and structural repeat unit.

The lithium battery of 34. claims 33, wherein
      Described ionic conductivity repetitive derives from and is selected from following at least one monomer: acrylic acid, methacrylic acid, methyl acrylate, methyl methacrylate, ethyl acrylate, EMA, 2-EHA, butyl methacrylate, 2-Ethylhexyl Methacrylate, decyl acrylate, ethylene vinyl acetate, oxirane and expoxy propane, and
      Described structural repeat unit derives from and is selected from following at least one monomer: styrene, 4-bromstyrol, t-butyl styrene, divinylbenzene, methyl methacrylate, isobutyl methacrylate, butadiene, ethene, propylene, dimethyl siloxane, isobutene, NIPA, vinylidene, acrylonitrile, 4-methyl-1-pentene, mutual-phenenyl two acid bromide two alcohol ester, ethylene glycol terephthalate and vinylpyridine.
The lithium battery of 35. claims 29, wherein said ionic conduction polymer is the block copolymer comprising ionic conductivity phase and structure phase.
